result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon L Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Restitution payments to be paid monthly to B.B. first.  Payment of restitution to be paid upon receipt of per capita payments.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Dismiss/read in Count 2.   Attorney Sacra gives agreement reached.  State agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands. No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty. State notes victim notification met.  Victim statement reviewed by parties and court.  State gives recommendation.  Defendant has been in custody for 10 months on a cash bond on this case.  Attorney Sacra gives argument.  Defendant will be transported to Jackson Co to take care of a warrant.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
3 years Probation
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling

Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sacra calls Drew Bulin, Sauk County Det.  Sworn & testifies.  Attorney Sacra goes through interviews conducted.  State objects to exh. 1-audio.  Attorney Sacra argues.  Court overrules objection.  Attorney Sacra proceeds.  State cross examines Det. Drew Bulin.  State requests to play video of SCSD pod.  Offers exh. 2-video at LEC.  Court received exh. 2.  Attorney Sacra offers exh. 1.  Court received exh. 1.  Attorney Sacra redirect of Det. Bulin.  Attorney Sacra calls Lewis Lange, Lt. with Sauk County Sheriff's Dept in charge of the jail.   Sworn & testifies re: pod layout and video/audio capabilities.  State cross examines Lt. Lange.  Attorney Sacra redirect.  State objects to replaying of portion of audio.  Attorney Sacra argues and request dismissal based on videotape not reserved.  Request court consider excluding all video.  State responds, argues.  Attorney Sacra responds.  Court denies motion.  Attorney Sacra recieved report from Dr. Berney.  Withdrawing NGI plea.  Court to set for scheduling conference.
of Dr. Berney $1350

Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Defendant Sheldon L Cloud in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sacra notes he's standby counsel to obtain records from Ho-Chunk re: trust funds being held.  Requests reset to continue to try and obtain those records.  Bonds continued. Defendant Sheldon L Cloud appears by video from LEC in custody.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE on income/assets.  DE advises he has over $200,000 in his Ho-Chunk trust fund but doesn't have access to it.  Court appoints standby counsel Greg Sacra (322 1st Ave #1, Baraboo (608) 356-3010) to represent DE in all open matters in Sauk County.  No order for repayment to be ordered yet as Atty Sacra could be able to assist DE in getting some of his trust fund monies to pay for private counsel as he's not indigent.  Court sets these matters to track w/his other two cases.  Bonds continued in all matters.
